intro: Tetratheca hirsuta var. alba, commonly known as the white-flowered tetratheca, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Theaceae and is characterized by its distinctive white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub with hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and sandy habitats. The flowers are small and clustered, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
